TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . She was represented before the ORG by PERSON K. Berzeg , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) did not designate an Agent for the purposes of the proceedings before the ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant is the owner of QUANTITY of land , in a plot of QUANTITY ( plot no . CARDINAL ) , in FAC , in the GPE district of GPE . The plot in question is situated in front of ORG , of which the applicant is a co - owner .

On DATE the applicant brought an action for compensation against ORG ( GPE FAC ) before ORG of First Instance . She submitted , inter alia , that GPE occupied plot no . CARDINAL illegally for the purposes of constructing a tube station in FAC . The applicant maintained that the GPE neither conducted expropriation proceedings nor compensated her for the damage resulting from the de facto taking of her property . She requested to be paid the value of the plot in question . She also submitted an expert report dated DATE in support of her claim . According to this report , the Municipality was in actual possession of plot no . CARDINAL/A.

The GPE denied the allegations and argued that they had been in actual possession of plot no . CARDINAL since DATE . They therefore argued that the applicant ’s action for compensation had to be rejected as being time - barred .

On DATE ORG submitted a sketch plan to ORG of First Instance according to which plot no . CARDINAL was situated next to CARDINAL other plots of land belonging to the applicant and her co - owners and was left by the owners as an access area .
On DATE ORG of First Instance requested the GPE and GPE Municipalities to submit information on whether plot no . CARDINAL was used by these municipalities .

On DATE ORG informed ORG of First Instance that the applicant was one of the co - owners of plot no . CARDINAL and that , in the registry records , it was stated that the plot was “ to be expropriated ” .
On DATE ORG informed the first - instance court that the applicant ’s land had been used by GPE since DATE .

On DATE ORG informed the firstinstance court that there had been a de facto interference with the applicant ’s co - ownership rights to plot no . CARDINAL by the LOC during the construction of the tube station in FAC .
On an unspecified date , the first - instance court ordered an expert report to be prepared in order to determine the value of plot no . CARDINAL/A.

On DATE a committee of experts submitted a report to ORG . According to the PERSON report , the Municipality was in actual possession of plot no . CARDINAL although the applicant was identified as the co - owner of the plot in the land registry records . The experts stated that the value of the land that the applicant co - owned was MONEY ( TRL ) ( MONEY ( ORG ) ) .

On DATE ORG informed ORG of First Instance that plot no . CARDINAL , which was located in front of ORG , had been used during the construction of the tube station with a view to ensuring the security of the surrounding area . Following the lodging of the case by the applicant , they separated the plot from the entrance to the tube station by means of a wall and restored the plot to its original state by paving it .

On DATE another expert report was drafted . According to this report , plot no . CARDINAL had been used during the construction of the tube station in FAC in order to ensure the security of the neighbouring buildings . The report further indicated that the plot in question had been paved by the Municipality and that it was used as a pedestrian area .

On DATE ORG held that GPE had been in actual possession of the land since DATE . It accordingly rejected the case as having been introduced outside the statutory time - limit laid down by LAW ( Law no . CARDINAL ) .
The applicant appealed .

On DATE ORG rendered its decision . It observed that according to the local master building and settlement plan ( imar planı ) , plot no . CARDINAL was used as an access area for the surrounding buildings . ORG considered that the administration could not therefore be considered to be in actual possession of the plot . It further held that the legal reasoning of the first - instance court was erroneous since plot no . CARDINAL had only been used to ensure the neighbouring NORP security during the construction of the tube station and that there had been no interference with the plot afterwards . ORG based its assessment on the expert report of DATE . It nevertheless agreed with ORG that the case should be dismissed and upheld the judgment of DATE , but for different reasons .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s request for rectification of the decision of DATE .
On DATE the decision of CARDINAL DATE was served on the applicant .
It appears from this document that the applicant is one of the co - owners of plot no . CARDINAL/A.

According to the judgment of ORG of CARDINAL DATE , on DATE ORG brought an action against the applicant ’s and her co - owners’ heirs and requested that the title to plot no . CARDINAL/A be transferred to it . The court dismissed the case .

The Municipality informed CARDINAL of the applicant ’s co - owners , PERSON , that plot no . CARDINAL was the front access area of the buildings next to the plot and that construction of a building on the plot was not possible .

The LOC proposed that ORG transfer the title to plot no . CARDINAL to it free of charge . It further proposed that the GPE would , in return , construct CARDINAL of the exits of the tube station in FAC - which would normally cost MONEY ( ORG ) - free of charge .

LAW no . CARDINAL on administrative procedure provides that any person who has suffered damage as a result of an act committed by the administration may request compensation from the administration . In the event of complete or partial rejection of a compensation request , or if no reply has been received within a time - limit of DATE , the person involved may initiate administrative proceedings .
